story_title: How One Man Stole the Eiffel Tower Twice
original_story: [excited] You won't believe this - in 1925, a con artist named Victor Lustig convinced scrap dealers he could sell the Eiffel Tower! He forged documents and made off with tons of metal before authorities caught on. Once arrested, he escaped and tried again! Lustig pulled this off twice, making it a wild tale of deception. He even claimed to be a government official! Can you imagine swindling an entire monument? Talk about ambition! What if I told you the Eiffel Tower was nearly reduced to scrap? [pause:1s]

Wide shot of the Eiffel Tower against a twilight sky, casting long shadows. In the foreground, Victor Lustig, a suave con artist in 1920s attire, gestures animatedly as he speaks to a group of bewildered scrap dealers, their expressions a mix of intrigue and disbelief.
